name: steel production, electric, low-alloyed | steel, low-alloyed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10806/documentation

This dataset represents the manufacturing of large alloyed steel slabs (2 to 25 tonnes). Iron scrap is used as the  main iron bearing input. Iron based alloys are added to acheived desired steel alloy composition. This dataset is based on data from the foundry department of an integrated forge.

Activity starts with the arrival of iron scrap at the electric arc furnace

This activity ends with the casting in ingot molds and cooling of alloyed steel slabs. The dataset includes: the foundry processes (including scrap metal input, EAF melting, ladle oven, alloying, degassing, and ingot casting)
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Dataset is representative of the Québec region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Quebec technology. An average for different alloys is represented.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on primary data from given region and technology. Some of the flows in this dataset have been directly copied from the ecoinvent 3.0 dataset "steel production, electric, low-alloyed, GLO, 2001", the uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Primary data collected from one manufacturing company in Québec.
